wikipedia_page.main: John Hibbard (7 September 1863 – 17 October 1905) was an English cricketer. He played four first-class matches for Kent in 1893.

response: Hibbard and his wife Josie had two children, Helen Hibbard (born 1891) and John Davis Hibbard (born 1895). After retiring, Hibbard moved to Hollywood, Los Angeles, California. At the time of the 1930 United States Census, he was living in a house valued at $50,000 at 1805 Fuller Avenue in Hollywood. He lived there with a housekeeper (May Glanville) and two servants.Census entry for John D. Hibbard. Ancestry.com. 1930 United States Federal Census [database on-line]. Census Place: Los Angeles, Los Angeles, California; Roll: 135; Page: 23A; Enumeration District: 91; Image: 1004.0; FHL microfilm: 2339870. In February 1931, Hibbard and his second wife May Hibbard traveled to Havana, Cuba on the S.S. Cartago.Ancestry.com. New Orleans, Passenger Lists, 1820–1945 [database on-line]. Provo, UT, USA: Ancestry.com Operations, Inc., 2006. Record for John and May Hibbard. In December 1935, Hibbard and his second wife May G. Hibbard traveled to Yokohama, Japan, aboard the S.S. Roseville.Ancestry.com. California Passenger and Crew Lists, 1882–1957 [database on-line]. Record for John D Hibbard. Hibbard's second wife appears to be the same person (May Glanville) who was listed as his housekeeper in the 1930 Census. The matching data points include first name, middle initial, place of birth (Ohio) and age (born c. 1874). In July 1937, Hibbard and his wife May traveled to Honolulu, Hawaii.Ancestry.com. California Passenger and Crew Lists, 1882–1957 [database on-line]. Record for John Hibbard. In November 1937, Hibbard died at age 72 in Hollywood.
